block.p: Catherine Jennifer Finnegan, the daughter of Carolyn La Corte of Cranford, N.J., and the late William R. Finnegan III, was married yesterday to Laurent Charles Pavageau, a son of Philippe Pavageau of Versailles, France, and the late Roxanne Pavageau. The Rev. Lupton Abshire performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Washington.
The bride, 27, and the bridegroom, 30, are associates at the law firm of Akin, Gump, Strauss, Hauer & Feld in Washington, where they met.

Catherine Jennifer Finnegan, the daughter of Carolyn La Corte of Cranford, N.J., and the late William R. Finnegan III, was married yesterday to Laurent Charles Pavageau, a son of Philippe Pavageau of Versailles, France, and the late Roxanne Pavageau. The Rev. Lupton Abshire performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Washington.
The bride, 27, and the bridegroom, 30, are associates at the law firm of Akin, Gump, Strauss, Hauer & Feld in Washington, where they met.

Ms. Finnegan, who is known as Tess, is keeping her surname. She graduated magna cum laude from Princeton and received a law degree magna cum laude from American University. Her mother is a career counselor at Cranford (N.J.) High School. The bride's father was an accountant in Boston.

Mr. Pavageau received undergraduate and law degrees cum laude from Duke University. His father is a marketing and sales consultant in Versailles to the fine crystal and glass industry. The bridegroom's mother taught English at the Lycee International in St.-Germain-en-Laye, France.
